intro: Psychotria silvicola, commonly known as the forest psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it typically grows in shaded, moist forest environments. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white or pale green flowers. Its fruits are small berries that contain seeds dispersed by animals. Psychotria silvicola is often found in understory layers of humid tropical forests, contributing to the biodiversity of these ecosystems.
